org.sandag.popsyn.balancer
Class Balancer

java.lang.Object
  org.sandag.popsyn.balancer.Balancer

public class Balancer
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles the balancing of PUMS sample household/GQ weights to control targets by TAZ. It also discretizes weights and writes output to the database.

aWriterDao - The data access object used to write balance objects to the database
aGeographyDao - The data access object for the Geography class of objects
Method Detail

balance

public void balance(Classifier classifier)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Balances PUMS sample household/GQ weights. Weights are balanced to control targets by balance geography (typically TAZ). A balance selector chooses households and GQs to be balanced in such a way that weights won't be balanced to small fractional values. After balance object selection, households and GQs are balanced together. A ConvergenceStat object is created to record the convergence status of each TAZ. This method finishes by calling a method to begin post-balancing steps, which include the integerization of weights and the allocation of Household objects from the TAZ level to the MGRA level.

Parameters:
classifier - the Classifier object
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isBalanceZone

private boolean isBalanceZone(int zone,
                              double hhTotal,
                              double gqTotal)
Determines whether a zone is subject to balancing. Only internal zones and TAZs with households or GQs can be balanced. This method returns a boolean indicating whether the zone qualifies as a balance zone.

Parameters:
zone - the zone to be evaluated
hhTotal - the zonal HH total
gqTotal - the zonal GQ total
Returns:
Returns a boolean value where true means a zone is a balance zone

calBalanceFactor

private double calBalanceFactor(double pumsVal,
                                double targetVal)
Calculates balancing factor for a given control category that will be used to update the initial HH/GQ weight. Balancing factors are calculated at the TAZ level for each control category by dividing the zonal target by a summation of weights over all balance objects.

Parameters:
pumsVal - the zonal sum of PUMS weights for this control category over all (participating) balance objects
targetVal - the zonal target value for this control category
Returns:
returns the calculated balancing factor

applyBalanceFactor

private void applyBalanceFactor(java.util.Set<Household> controlObjs,
                                double bf,
                                IControlDefinition<Household> def,
                                double zHHTotal,
                                double zGQTotal)
Updates individual HH/GQ weights using the calculated balancing factor (which is specific to the given control category and balance iteration). The new weight is calculated as a product of the existing weight and the balancing factor exponentiated by the participation factor. Balance factors are only applied to HHs/GQs with a non-zero weight and non-zero participation factor.

Parameters:
controlObjs - the balance objects (HHs and GQs)
bf - the calculated balancing factor
def - the control category for which the balancing factor was calculated
zHHTotal - the zonal HH total
zGQTotal - the zonal GQ total

postBalance

private void postBalance(int bzone,
                         java.util.Set<Household> balancedObjs,
                         double zHHTotal,
                         double zGQTotal,
                         BalanceGeographies bg,
                         org.sandag.common.montecarlo.RandomSeedManager<java.lang.Integer> rdm)
Undertakes a number of necessary post-balancing steps. HHs and GQs are separated so they can be discretized separately to zonal HH/GQ totals from the target table. Balance objects are discretized, allocated to MGRAs, and written to output tables in the database.

Parameters:
bzone - the balance zone (typically, TAZ)
balancedObjs - the balance objects (HHs and GQs)
zHHTotal - the zonal HH total
zGQTotal - the zonal GQ total
bg - the BalanceGeographies object
rdm - the RandomSeedManager object, which ensures that seeds used for random number generation are the same across PopSyn runs

discretize

private java.util.Set<Household> discretize(java.util.Set<Household> objs,
                                            int bzone,
                                            double zTotal,
                                            org.sandag.common.montecarlo.RandomSeedManager<java.lang.Integer> rdm)
Discretizes HH/GQ weights. The balanced weights of PUMS sample households and group quarters are non-integer values. These values are integerized while maintaining the marginal totals.

Parameters:
objs - the balance objects (hh/gq)
bzone - the balance zone (TAZ)
zTotal - the zonal HH or GQ total
rdm - the RandomSeedManager object, which ensures that seeds used for random number generation are the same across PopSyn runs
Returns:
Returns a set of Household objects with discretized weights

allocate

private java.util.Set<Household> allocate(java.lang.String type,
                                          int bzone,
                                          java.util.List<Geography> alZones,
                                          org.sandag.common.montecarlo.RandomSeedManager<java.lang.Integer> rdm,
                                          java.util.Set<Household> discretizedObjs)
Allocates households and GQs from TAZs to the MGRAs that are within the TAZ. A Monte Carlo procedure is used to select an MGRA for each GQ and household according to the distribution of HH/GQ.

Parameters:
type - a String indicating HH or GQ
bzone - the balance zone (typically TAZ)
alZones - a list of allocation zones (typically MGRA)
rdm - the RandomSeedManager object, which ensures that seeds used for random number generation are the same across PopSyn runs
discretizedObjs - a set of Household objects with discretized weights
Returns:
Returns a set of Household objects, each of which has been assigned to an MGRA

write

private void write(java.util.Set<Household> hhObjs,
                   java.util.Set<Household> gqObjs,
                   int bzone,
                   Version aVersion,
                   boolean writeAllocated)
Writes balance objects to a database table.

Parameters:
hhObjs - the households to be written out
gqObjs - the GQs to be written out
bzone - the balance zone
aVersion - the version object associated with this PopSyn run
writeAllocated - a boolean indicating whether to write discretized objects (before allocation) to the database or whether to write allocated objects. True indicates writing pre-allocation discretized objects. False indicates writing allocated objects.

separate

private void separate(java.util.Set<Household> objs)
Separates households and GQs.

Parameters:
objs - the set of balance objects to be separated

useAllSamplesInPums

private java.util.Set<Household> useAllSamplesInPums(Classifier classifier,
                                                     int puma,
                                                     Version aVersion)
An option that increases the sample of HH/GQ used for balancing in each TAZ to include all HH/GQ in the corresponding PUMA

Parameters:
classifier - the Classifier object
puma - an int denoting the PUMA that contains the balance zone
aVersion - the Version object associated with this PopSyn run
Returns:
Returns a set with the entire PUMA sample of HH and GQ
